name: Chest Press
how_to_perform:
1. Adjust a standard bench press machine to fit your body, with the bar at shoulder height.

2. Lie back on the bench and grip the bar with an overhand grip (palms facing downwards).

3. Extend your arms upward to lift the weight off the rack.

4. Press the weight upwards by extending your elbows fully, squeezing your chest muscles as you do so.

5. Slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position by bending your elbows and letting your shoulders follow the downward movement of the bar.

6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, keeping control throughout the exercise.

7. Ensure to rest when needed between sets.
short_summary: Chest press is a upper body exercise that primarily works the chest muscles and can be performed using a bench press machine.
